title: üê† Stripe Functionality

apis.title: GET Account
apis.description: Get details of Stripe account being used

apis.title: üíµ Balance
apis.description: Retrieves the current account balance, based on the authentication that was used to make the request

apis.title: 1Ô∏è‚É£ GET Token
apis.description: Retrieves the token with the given ID

apis.title: ü™ú GET Prices
apis.description: Prices define the unit cost, currency, and (optional) billing cycle for both recurring and one-time purchases of products

apis.title: üôÖ List all disputes
apis.description: Returns a list of your disputes.

apis.title: ü§å GET Application Fees
apis.description: Get details of Stripe account being used

groups.title: Accounts
groups.description: This is an object representing a Stripe account. You can retrieve it to see properties on the account like its current e-mail address or if the account is enabled yet to make live charges.

groups.title: Application Fees
groups.description: When you collect a transaction fee on top of a charge made for your user (using Connect), an Application Fee object is created in your account. You can list, retrieve, and refund application fees.

groups.title: External Accounts
groups.description: External Accounts are transfer destinations on Account objects for connected accounts. They can be bank accounts or debit cards.

messages.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è It appears you are using a bank account identifier. Expected bank token (btok_...)
‚ö†Ô∏è It appears you are using a payment method. Expected card token (tok_...)

groups.title: Persons
groups.description: This is an object representing a person associated with a Stripe account

apis.title: üìñ list persons by account
apis.description: Returns a list of people associated with the account‚Äôs legal entity. The people are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent people appearing first.

apis.title: ü™ô ü™ô Verify ACH micro deposits
apis.warn: ‚ö†Ô∏è Bank account token must be associated with customer

messages.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è It appears you are using a bank token which is NOT usable here. Use bank account id "ba_" instead
‚ö†Ô∏è It appears you are using a bank source which is NOT truly a source. Fetch bank sources using GET /customers/:id/sources
‚ö†Ô∏è It appears you are using a bank token which is NOT a source

groups.title: Charges

apis.title: üßæ List all charges
apis.description: Returns a list of charges you‚Äôve previously created. The charges are returned in sorted order, with the most recent charges appearing first.

apis.title: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Retrieve a charge
apis.description: Retrieves the details of a charge that has previously been created. Supply the unique charge ID that was returned from your previous request, and Stripe will return the corresponding charge information. The same information is returned when creating or refunding the charge.

apis.title: ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Update a charge
apis.description: Updates the specified charge by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

apis.title: Capture a charge
apis.description: Capture the payment of an existing, uncaptured, charge. This is the second half of the two-step payment flow, where first you created a charge with the capture option set to false.

groups.description: To charge a credit or a debit card, you create a Charge object. You can retrieve and refund individual charges as well as list all charges. Charges are identified by a unique, random ID.

groups.title: Customers
groups.description: Customer objects allow you to perform recurring charges, and to track multiple charges, that are associated with the same customer. The API allows you to create, delete, and update your customers. You can retrieve individual customers as well as a list of all your customers.

groups.title: Disputes

apis.title: üö´ close a dispute
apis.description: Closing the dispute for a charge indicates that you do not have any evidence to submit and are essentially dismissing the dispute, acknowledging it as lost.

apis.title: üÜï Create issuing dispute
apis.description: Creates an Issuing Dispute object. Individual pieces of evidence within the evidence object are optional at this point

groups.description: A dispute occurs when a customer questions your charge with their card issuer. When this happens, you're given the opportunity to respond to the dispute with evidence that shows that the charge is legitimate.

groups.title: Pay Intents

apis.title: üÜï Create Pay Intent
apis.description: Creates a PaymentIntent object

pastes.title: Create pay intent as another account

apis.title: üëç Confirm Pay Intent
apis.description: If a pay intent requires verification

groups.description: A PaymentIntent guides you through the process of collecting a payment from your customer.

groups.title: Payouts
groups.description: A Payout object is created when you receive funds from Stripe, or when you initiate a payout to either a bank account or debit card of a connected Stripe account.

apis.title: üßæ List all payouts
apis.description: Returns a list of existing payouts sent to third-party bank accounts or that Stripe has sent you. The payouts are returned in sorted order, with the most recently created payouts appearing first.

apis.title: üÜï Create payout
apis.description: To send funds to your own bank account, you create a new payout object.

apis.title: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Retrieve a payout
apis.description: Retrieves the details of an existing payout. Supply the unique payout ID from either a payout creation request or the payout list, and Stripe will return the corresponding payout information.

apis.title: ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Update a payout
apis.description: Updates the specified payout by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged. This request accepts only the metadata as arguments.

groups.title: Refunds
groups.description: refund a charge that has previously been created but not yet refunded. Funds will be refunded to the credit or debit card that was originally charged.

apis.title: üÜï Create Refund
apis.description: Creating a new refund will refund a charge that has previously been created but not yet refunded. Funds will be refunded to the credit or debit card that was originally charged.

apis.title: üßæ List all refunds
apis.description: Returns a list of all refunds you‚Äôve previously created. The refunds are returned in sorted order, with the most recent refunds appearing first. For convenience, the 10 most recent refunds are always available by default on the charge object.

apis.title: 1Ô∏è‚É£ GET refund
apis.description: Retrieves the details of an existing refund.

apis.title: ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Update refund
apis.description: Updates the specified refund by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

groups.title: Transfers
groups.description: A Transfer object is created when you move funds between Stripe accounts as part of Connect.

apis.title: üßæ List all transfers
apis.description: Returns a list of existing transfers sent to connected accounts. The transfers are returned in sorted order, with the most recently created transfers appearing first.

apis.title: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Retrieve a transfer
apis.description: Retrieves the details of an existing transfer. Supply the unique transfer ID from either a transfer creation request or the transfer list, and Stripe will return the corresponding transfer information.

apis.title: ‚Ü©Ô∏è üÜï Create a transfer reversal
apis.description: When reversing transfers, you can optionally reverse part of the transfer. You can do so as many times as you wish until the entire transfer has been reversed.

apis.title: ‚Ü©Ô∏è üßæ List all reversals
apis.description: list of the reversals belonging to a specific transfer. Note that the 10 most recent reversals are always available by default on the transfer object.

apis.title: ‚Ü©Ô∏è 1Ô∏è‚É£ Retrieve reversal
apis.description: By default, you can see the 10 most recent reversals stored directly on the transfer object, but you can also retrieve details about a specific reversal stored on the transfer.
